Brooklyn Laboratory Charter Schools (LAB) will be closing effective March 16, 2020 - April 24, 2020 and transition to home instruction.
If you are in need of a Chromebook please email studenttech@brooklynlaboratoryschool.org.
Click here for more details including instructional guides. Email studenttech@brooklynlaboratoryschool.org for tech support.
LAB is committed to doing everything we can to help our students and families that may be affected by the Coronavirus (COVID-19). We understand that hardships may arise and are prepared to assist you. To request financial support obtaining basic necessities, please fill out this survey.
Please contact supportfund@brooklynlaboratoryschool.org with any questions or concerns. div.p: The mission of Brooklyn Laboratory Charter Schools (LAB) is to prepare scholars with the academic foundation, digital literacy, and leadership skills necessary to succeed in college and professional life as they grow as ethical leaders.
Together, the LAB community will achieve its mission through:

li.p: An extended learning day, week, and year
Frequent opportunities for enrichment and passion-driven learning
A commitment to knowing every scholar and giving them the tools to succeed
An environment focused on entrepreneurial learning
A joyous structured school culture that stresses positive youth development and scaffolds to independence

div.p: LAB will provide a rigorous academic program focused on the knowledge, skills, and
character necessary to master core academic subjects in preparation for success in college
and careers. Scholars will receive a structured civic and leadership education so that all of
our graduates are prepared to be active and productive citizens in their communities. To
enliven the kind of school that we are seeking to create, all members of the LAB
community are expected to adhere to the following CREED:

img.alt: Jonathan Robinson - fellow photos at LAB.jpg

li.p: More Time in School: Extended day, week, and school year focused on academic learning and unique enrichment activities (e.g., Robotics, Digital Media, Coding, Debate, Visual Arts).
High Dose Tutoring: Personalized, small group tutoring from trained college graduates for at least two hours each day.
Next Generation Learning: A college prep curriculum with Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math (STEAM)-focused enrichment activities to prepare students to succeed in jobs of the future.
